words.description: Near the beginning of a particular time or period.
Later than usual or than expected.
Switch on (an electric light).
Cause (a fire or light) to cease to burn or shine.
Achieved without great effort; presenting few difficulties.
Needing much effort or skill to accomplish, deal with, or understand.
Moving or capable of moving at high speed.
Moving or operating, or designed to do so, only at a low speed; not quick or fast.
Of great or more than average height, especially (with reference to an object) relative to width.
Of less than average height from top to bottom or to the top from the ground.
Having or showing a friendly, generous, and considerate nature.
Willfully causing pain or suffering to others, or feeling no concern about it.
The state of being happy.
The condition or quality of being sad.
A feeling of expectation and desire for a certain thing to happen.
The complete loss or absence of hope.
Find (something or someone) unexpectedly or in the course of a search.
Keep from sight; hide.
Gain or acquire knowledge of or skill in (something) by study, experience, or being taught.
Show or explain to (someone) how to do something.
Be deprived of or cease to have or retain (something).
Be successful or victorious in (a contest or conflict).
Vocal or instrumental sounds (or both) combined in such a way as to produce beauty of form, harmony, and expression of emotion.
A short poem or other set of words set to music or meant to be sung.
A story or event recorded by a camera as a set of moving images and shown in a theater or on television; a motion picture.
A written or printed work consisting of pages glued or sewn together along one side and bound in covers.
An account of imaginary or real people and events told for entertainment.
A periodical publication containing articles and illustrations, typically covering a particular subject or area of interest.
A printed publication (usually issued daily or weekly) consisting of folded unstapled sheets and containing news, articles, advertisements, and correspondence.
A particular item or object, typically one of a specified type.
A person who writes books, stories, or articles as a job or regular occupation.
A person who writes poems.
A person whose profession is acting on the stage, in movies, or on television.
A female actor.
An artist who paints pictures.
An artist who makes sculptures.
A qualified practitioner of medicine; a physician.
A person trained to care for the sick or infirm, especially in a hospital.
A person who designs, builds, or maintains engines, machines, or structures.
A person who designs buildings and in many cases also supervises their construction.
A person who practices or studies law; an attorney or a counselor.
A public officer appointed to decide cases in a law court.
A teacher of the highest rank in a college or university.
A person who is studying or has expert knowledge of one or more of the natural or physical sciences.
A person who carries out academic or scientific research.
A professional cook, typically the chief cook in a restaurant or hotel.
A person who prepares and cooks food, especially as a job or in a specified way.
A person who operates the flying controls of an aircraft.
A person whose job is to extinguish fires.
A person who is a member of a police force.
A person who serves in an army.
A person who makes and repairs wooden objects and structures.
A person who installs and maintains electrical equipment.
A person who installs and repairs the pipes and fittings of water supply, sanitation, or heating systems.
A person who repairs and maintains machinery.
A person who makes bread and cakes, especially commercially.
A person who catches fish for a living or for sport.
A person who owns or manages a farm.
A person who sings, especially professionally.
A person who plays a musical instrument, especially as a profession, or is musically talented.
A person who dances or whose profession is dancing.
A person who has written a particular text.
The action or skill of using paint, either in a picture or as decoration.
The art of making two- or three-dimensional representative or abstract forms, especially by carving stone or wood or by casting metal or plaster.
Literary work in which the expression of feelings and ideas is given intensity by the use of distinctive style and rhythm; poems collectively or as a genre of literature.
A fictitious prose narrative of book length, typically representing character and action with some degree of realism.
